alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 4:32PM EDT until July 14 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Cainhoy to Awendaw and Germantown. As much as 1 to 3 inches of rain has fallen in this area this afternoon. An additional 1 inch could fall through 545 PM as showers and thunderstorms slowly weaken. The risk for minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Pleasant, McClellanville, Awendaw, Hampton Plantation State Park, Wando, Cainhoy, Santee Coastal Reserve, Halfway Creek, Buck Hall, Tibwin, Dunes West, Germantown, Park West, South Santee and Rivertowne.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
